alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 7:57PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Stevens and southwestern Pend Oreille Counties through 830 PM PDT... At 756 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 2 miles east of Chewelah moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Stevens and southwestern Pend Oreille Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
